team.name: The SkatePark Project
team.what: Nonprofit organization working to increase access to outdoor recreation and free play in underserved communities through the creation of safe and inclusive skateparks.

items.description: Cost for the Nouns artwork and noggles rail

items.name: Project Approval
items.description: Obtain approval from City of Long Beach Councilmember Roberto Uranga and City of Long Beach Department of Parks, Recreation and Marine

items.name: Construction
items.description: Commence the construction of the skatepark during summer 2023

items.name: Nouns Artwork and Noggles Rail Installation
items.description: Coordinate with ASK and Van Eggers for Nouns artwork and Keen Ramps for the Noggles Rail installation

description: We seek funding to revitalize Silverado Park Skatepark in Long Beach, California, with new elements and relocate the ones that are still skateable. The area surrounding the skatepark is predominantly low-income, with many at-risk youths with few recreational opportunities. Together with the local Action Sports Kids (ASK) Foundation, we will unlock the potential of Silverado Skatepark to create a space that will benefit Long Beach area skaters, youth, and community members for generations to come.

project.name: Silverado Skatepark Renovation
project.description: Revitalization of Silverado Park Skatepark in Long Beach, California

title: TSP x ASK Long Beach: Silverado Skatepark
